Deﬁnition 2.23 (Image and Kernel).
For Φ : V →W, we deﬁne the kernel/null spacekernel
null space
ker(Φ) := Φ−1(0W) = {v∈V : Φ(v) = 0W} (2.122)
and the image/rangeimage
range
Im(Φ) := Φ(V) = {w∈W|∃v∈V : Φ(v) = w}. (2.123)
We also call V and W also the domain and codomain of Φ, respectively .domain
codomain
Intuitively , the kernel is the set of vectors in v ∈V that Φ maps onto
